definitions.definition: The overside or up-side of a flat object such as a table, or of a liquid.
The outside hull of a tangible object.

definitions.example: On the surface, the spy looked like a typical businessman.

definitions.definition: The locus of an equation (especially one with exactly two degrees of freedom) in a more-than-two-dimensional space.
(fortification) That part of the side which is terminated by the flank prolonged, and the angle of the nearest bastion.
To provide something with a surface.
To apply a surface to something.
For information or facts to become known.
To make information or facts known.
To work a mine near the surface.
